description: telephone in the shape of a tennis shoe; white with blue trim; ear piece, mouth piece, key pad and hang-up switch on underside; white cord
text: Cleverly disguised, this phone's push-button dial is installed on the sole of the shoe.  Many corporations capitalized on novelty telephones as a means of marketing and advertising.  This phone was distributed by the magazine <I>Sports Illustrated<I> as a promotional gambit.
title: "Tennis Shoe" model 0202 push-button telephone
